Secret Thoughts

Jul 1, 2016 • By Alexander Puskin

Trying not to think is the best way for anybody to be happy. There’s just so much information around you, floating about and occasionally, just occasionally, making sense. I picked up the habit long ago of quietly reciting a poem in my mind when I was scared, trying to clear my mind. Recently, and I mean today, I started the habit of focusing on the now and not thinking about anything at all by reciting a small scrap of poem in mind over and over again. The results were immediate and pronounced. It was like ducking your head under water. Immediately as you head goes below water, all sounds becomes indistinct and eerie. I found out that most of my troubles could be simply shut out. I could choose not to listen and to pick up each individual tendril of thought from one another and analyses them. Most of what I thought each moment was unnecessary. Instead of constantly analyzing the world around me, I could choose to focus on just what was important. If you’d like to try this out, I recommend somewhere solitary and silent.
